# setDefaultPlaceholder(_:for:with:)

**Type Method**

Sets `placeholder` as the default placeholder for the `binding`, when a key value coding compliant property of an instance of the receiving class returns the value specified by `marker`, and no other placeholder has been specified.

## Declaration

```swift
class func setDefaultPlaceholder(_ placeholder: Any?, for marker: Any?, with binding: NSBindingName)
```

## Discussion

The `marker` can be `nil` or one of the constants described in [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/AppKit/selection-markers].

## Related Documentation

- **Cocoa Bindings Programming Topics**

## Deprecated Class Methods

- **defaultPlaceholder(for:with:)**: Returns an object that will be used as the placeholder for the `binding`, when a key value coding compliant property of an instance of the receiving class returns the value specified by `marker`, and no other placeholder has been specified.
- **useStoredAccessor()**: Returns `true` if the stored value methods [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/storedValue(forKey:)] and [doc://com.apple.objectivec/documentation/ObjectiveC/NSObject-swift.class/takeStoredValue(_:forKey:)] should use private accessor methods in preference to public accessors.
